text:
The links for the following have changed:

/host-manager  	Tomcat Manager Application
/manager  	Tomcat Manager Application

^ do not work; they need /html added at the end.

Also the /host-manager/html is called "Tomcat Virtual Host Manager",
and /manager/html is "Tomcat Web Application Manager"
creator: sebb@apache.org
knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text:
> Broken links on Manager List Applications page  

On what page? Please clarify.

> Also the /host-manager/html is called "Tomcat Virtual Host Manager",
> and /manager/html is "Tomcat Web Application Manager"

I do not understand the above either. Where is it called so?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Manager has a link called "List Applications"(In reply to comment #1)
> > Broken links on Manager List Applications page  
> 
> On what page? Please clarify.

Click "Tomcat Manager"
Click "List Applications"

which takes you to e.g.

http://localhost:8080/manager/html/list

> > Also the /host-manager/html is called "Tomcat Virtual Host Manager",
> > and /manager/html is "Tomcat Web Application Manager"
> 
> I do not understand the above either. Where is it called so?

When you click on the links, that's what it says near the top of the page just under the ASF/Tomcat banner.

e.g. http://localhost:8080/host-manager/html

(In reply to comment #0)
> The links for the following have changed:
> 
> /host-manager      Tomcat Manager Application
> /manager      Tomcat Manager Application
> 
> ^ do not work; they need /html added at the end.

Entirely as expected. This is not a bug.

> Also the /host-manager/html is called "Tomcat Virtual Host Manager",
> and /manager/html is "Tomcat Web Application Manager"

Already fixed.
creator: markt@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Why is this not a bug?

The other links on the page work perfectly OK, and adding /html to the links would allow them to work.

If the links are not intended to work, then surely they should not be links?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
In fact if you do follow the /manager link it says:

"The page you tried to access (/manager/) does not exist.

The Manager application has been re-structured for Tomcat 7 onwards and some of URLs have changed. All URLs used to access the Manager application should now start with one of the following options:

    * /manager/html for the HTML GUI
    * /manager/text for the text interface
    * /manager/jmxproxy for the JMX proxy
    * /manager/status for the status pages

Note that the URL for the text interface has changed from "/manager" to "/manager/text".

You probably need to adjust the URL you are using to access the Manager application. However, there is always a chance you have found a bug in the Manager application. If you are sure you have found a bug, and that the bug has not already been reported, please report it to the Apache Tomcat team. "

which is what I am trying to do here...

Similarly for /host-manager

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
The application list in the manager webapp simply lists all known contexts. The link provided for each context is a convenience link for an admin to jump into the respective context. The link assumes, that there is some reasonable content available directly under the context path. This might be true for some contexts that use e.g. welcome pages or have a servlet mapping for /, but there will also be contexts which do not produce any reasonable response when their conext root is called.

Yes, manager and host-manager are not general applications but instead provided by the Tomcat project. Nevertheless producing special links just for the manager and host-manager will bloat the code and only work as long as the admin doesn't deploy them under a different context name - or doesn't deploy something else under the names manager or host-manager. IMHO that's the reason for INVALID.
